title: AWS Config
description: Monitors and **records config changes** tracks what changed and when. <u>**Evaluates compliance**</u> & notifies you of any changes or **compliance violations**.

title: AWS Budgets
description: Set <u>**spending or usage limits for services**</u>. Get alerts. Plan and **monitor your spending or service usage**. See your current usage, forecasted usage.

title: AWS CloudWatch
description: <u>**Monitors metrics**</u> (<u>**CPU, memory, disk usage, latency**</u>). collects logs. Alerts you. Automate responses.

title: CloudTrail
description: logs all <u>**API activity in your AWS account**</u>. records <u>**account activity and API**</u>. help with auditing, <u>**compliance**</u>, and security.

title: Cost Explorer
description: tool that shows <u>**AWS spending trends**</u>, breakdowns by service, and usage insights over time. <u>**By instance type, region, account, or tag**</u>.

title: ElastiCache
description: <u>**in-memory caching service**</u> for fast data retrieval. accelerates database performance Quick answers for common requests.

title: S3 Standard
description: <u>**High performance, low latency storage**</u> for frequently accessed ‘hot’ data. Best for active apps, content distribution, and <u>**big data analytic.**</u>

title: S3 Intelligent Tiering
description: <u>**Moves objects between frequent and infrequent tiers**</u> to optimize costs. No retrieval fees, for <u>**unpredictable access patterns.**</u>

title: S3 Standard-IA
description: <u>**Infrequent access**</u> <u>**Low-cost storage**</u> for data accessed less often but <u>**needs fast retrieval**</u>. Good backups, disaster recovery, and <u>**infrequently used data.**</u>

title: S3 Glacier Deep Archive
description: Lowest cost for <u>**long-term retention and compliance**</u>. Best for archival, legal hold, and <u>**regulatory data**</u>.

title: AWS Inspector
description: scans <u>**workloads for vulnerabilities**</u>. outdated software, <u>**misconfigurations**</u>, and risks. <u>**security assessment tool**</u>.

title: AWS Direct Connect
description: provides a <u>**private connection between your on-prem and AWS**</u>. Private hallway to the cloud. Better perform, reliability, and <u>**lower latency**</u>.

title: Basic Support
description: Free tier with access to <u>**whitepapers, documentation, forums, and 7 core Trusted Advisor checks**</u>. No technical case support, suitable for experimentation and learning.

title: Developer Support
description: <u>**Business-hour technical support**</u>, <u>**general architecture guidance**</u>. 24-hour response time for general guidance; dev/test envs.

title: Business Support
description: <u>**Full Trusted Advisor checks**</u>, and <u>**third-party software integration help**</u>. ideal for production. responses for production issues;

title: Enterprise On-Ramp Support
description: <u>**TAM pool access**</u>, <u>**cost optimization workshops**</u>, and <u>**limited proactive architecture reviews**</u>. Best for organizations scaling toward enterprise operations.

title: Enterprise Support
description: Highest tier with a <u>**dedicated TAM (Technical Account Manager)**</u>, <u>**proactive architecture guidance**</u>, operations reviews, and  <u>**15-min response for critical issues**</u>. Best for mission-critical workloads.

title: IAM Roles
description: Grant <u>**temporary permissions to users or services**</u>. Used for <u>**cross-account access or service-to-service interactions**</u>.

title: IAM Groups
description: A container for users. <u>**Organize users and apply IAM policies at the group level for consistent permissions**</u>.

title: IAM Policies
description: <u>**Grant or deny specific permissions to users, groups, or roles.**</u> Define what actions and resources are allowed.

title: Service Control Policies (SCPs)
description: Organization-wide guardrails in AWS Organizations. <u>**Restrict what actions are possible across accounts, even if IAM policies allow them.**</u>

title: Security Groups
description: <u>**Stateful firewalls for individual EC2 instances.**</u> Automatically allow <u>**return traffic for allowed inbound requests.**</u>

title: Network ACLs (NACLs)
description: <u>**Stateless firewalls for entire subnets.**</u> Require explicit rules for <u>**inbound and outbound traffic.**</u>

title: Read Replicas
description: <u>**Improve read performance of a database by creating replicas.**</u> Ideal for scaling read-heavy workloads horizontally.

title: AWS Global Accelerator
description: Create accelerators to improve the performance of your applications for local and global users. <u>**Create IPs**</u> <u>**Optimizes network paths for TCP and UDP traffic**</u> low latency and high availability.

title: Amazon Macie
description: A security service that uses <u>**machine learning to automatically find and protect sensitive data**</u>, such as personally identifiable information (PII) <u>**stored in Amazon S3.**</u>

title: Amazon Aurora
description: A <u>**relational database**</u> that is compatible with <u>**MySQL and PostgreSQL**</u>, but faster and more scalable. <u>**Automatically replicates data**</u> across multiple AZ for high availability.

title: AWS Certificate Manager
description: <u>**Manages SSL/TLS certificates**</u> to secure websites or applications. Provisions, deploys, and <u>**renews certificates.**</u>

title: AWS Application Migration Service
description: Helps <u>**migrate applications from on-premises to AWS**</u> with minimal downtime. <u>**Replicates servers in AWS**</u> and automates migration without re-architecting apps.

title: AWS Systems Manager
description: A tool to manage and <u>**automate tasks across AWS resources.**</u> Centralized <u>**dashboard for patching**</u>, running scripts, viewing logs, and inventory management.

title: AWS Service Catalog
description: Lets <u>**organizations create and manage AWS resource templates**</u>. Helps <u>**enforce compliance**</u> and standardize deployments for teams.

title: AWS Artifact
description: A <u>**portal for compliance reports and agreements.**</u> Download documents like ISO certifications or SOC <u>**audit reports**</u> for auditing purposes.

title: AWS Shield
description: A <u>**DDoS protection service**</u> that automatically <u>**protects AWS resources**</u>. Shield Standard: Free and automatic protection. Shield Advanced: Extra protection with 24/7 AWS security team support.

title: Amazon Kinesis
description: Enables <u>**real-time processing and analysis of streaming data.**</u> Collect, process, and analyze real-time data. <u>**low latency and flexible consumption patterns.**</u>

title: AWS Well-Architected Tool
description: A tool to <u>**review workloads against AWS best practices.**</u> Based on the Well-Architected Framework’s 6 pillars. <u>**Identifies risks and offers improvement guidance.**</u>

title: Operational Excellence
description: Running <u>**workloads efficiently**</u> and <u>**improving processes over time.**</u> Automate operations, monitor systems, <u>**respond to events quickly.**</u>

title: Security
description: <u>**Protecting data, systems, and assets.**</u> Implement IAM, encryption, and logging. <u>**Least privilege access.**</u>

title: Reliability
description: Ensuring <u>**workloads perform correctly and recover quickly from failures.**</u> Design for <u>**high availability and automatic recovery.**</u>

title: Performance Efficiency
description: Using computing resources <u>**efficiently and scaling as needed.**</u> Choose the <u>**right instance types, use auto-scaling, and leverage managed services.**</u>

title: Cost Optimization
description: Reducing <u>**unnecessary costs and optimizing spending.**</u> Pay only for what you use, use <u>**Spot/Reserved instances, monitor spending.**</u>

title: Sustainability
description: <u>**Reducing environmental impact of cloud workloads.**</u> Optimize for energy efficiency, <u>**reduce unused resources.**</u>

title: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall)
description: <u>**Protecting web applications from common exploits and attacks.**</u> (e.g., block <u>**SQL injection, XSS**</u>). Works with Amazon CloudFront, ALB, and API Gateway.

title: Amazon Machine Image
description: a template used to <u>**launch Amazon EC2 instances (virtual servers) in the AWS cloud.**</u> a <u>**blueprint**</u>, containing the operating system, applications, and configuration settings needed for a server to run.
